metadata.title: CVE-2022-41325 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An integer overflow in the VNC module in VideoLAN VLC Media Player through3.0.17.4 allows attackers, by tricking a user into opening a craftedplaylist or connecting to a rogue VNC server, to crash VLC or execute codeunder some conditions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-41325` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvlc-bin - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
libvlc5 - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
libvlccore9 - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
vlc - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
vlc-bin - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
vlc-data - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
vlc-l10n - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
vlc-plugin-access-extra - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
vlc-plugin-base - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
vlc-plugin-fluidsynth - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
vlc-plugin-jack - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
vlc-plugin-notify - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
vlc-plugin-qt - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
vlc-plugin-samba - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
vlc-plugin-skins2 - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
vlc-plugin-svg - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
vlc-plugin-video-output - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
vlc-plugin-video-splitter - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
vlc-plugin-visualization - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: vlc package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
